The stylist was attentive and asked about our hair preferences, ensuring we were comfortable with the styles we chose. I opted for loose waves, while my cousin went for a sleek, straight look. Both styles turned out beautifully, lasting well into our night out. 

The atmosphere was chic with a modern vibe, and the music they played added to the overall fun experience. The staff was friendly and professional, and they didn't rush through the service, which I appreciated. Prices were reasonable, especially considering the prime location so close to the strip.

This dry bar made our prep for the night out enjoyable and stress-free, definitely a gem worth visiting if you're in Vegas. We'll absolutely be returning on our next trip to make sure our hair is on point for the festivities!

okay, i dont get what the employees' problems are here but i felt as if i was a big bad criminal about to steal overpriced lollipops & candy. NOT!!! i dont even have a big sweet tooth to begin with!\n\nmy bf and i were walking down the strip and decided, \""hey why not stop in here for a bit?\"" so we did, but once we got in we were greeted..which yes i totally get it, customer service all the guests...yes yes yes. but i dont know about being stopped Okay, I don’t get what the employees' problems are here but I felt as if I was a big bad criminal about to steal overpriced lollipops & candy. NOT!!! I don’t even have a big sweet tooth to begin with!

My bf and I were walking down the strip and decided, "Hey why not stop in here for a bit?" So we did, but once we got in we were greeted... which yes I totally get it, customer service all the guests... yes yes yes. But I don’t know about being stopped every two seconds by staff members asking if we needed help. It was overwhelming and honestly made us feel unwelcome, like we were under constant surveillance. The store itself is cute and colorful, but the tense atmosphere was a huge turnoff. A little more space to enjoy browsing without feeling like a suspect would have made this visit so much better. We left sooner than planned and probably won't be back.

Awesome hotel, beautiful suites - with bathrooms the size of a typical NYC hotel room, incredible pool deck, great staff, great service, excellent elevators, excellent housekeeping. Front desk could use quite a few more clerks, and while they are very very nice, it would be helpful if they could be both nice and efficient, it took about 6-10 minutes for each check-in.

Pool areas are fantastic, heated pools, nice lounge chairs, towels and chair covers, lots of bars (they make a lotta $$ off those $10 cocktails). Despite the small hiccup at check-in, the overall experience was delightful. The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated, providing a relaxing retreat after a day of exploration. The housekeeping staff deserves a special mention for their meticulous attention to detail. The location is perfect for accessing local attractions while offering a serene escape from the city hustle. With just a little tweak at the front desk, this place would be absolutely flawless. Highly recommend for a luxurious getaway

Oh Modern Grove, you were so pretty - yes, you turned my head and I was draw into your inner sanctum - once again, so lovely - a delightful place to hang out and have a beer - like a little section of hipster Santa Monica brought into the desert - as a bar, I would give you 4 stars, but as a restaurant, I'm sorry to say, all style and not much substance.\n\nMore specifically, I ordered the white sauce pizza with the cured ham and the arugula - it sounded good but as I sat down with my slice, I found myself underwhelmed. The crust was unfortunately more chewy than crisp, and the white sauce lacked the depth and flavor I was hoping for. The arugula was fresh, but the cured ham felt sparse, leaving the pizza feeling a bit unbalanced in terms of flavors and textures. While the ambiance was inviting, with its charming decor and cozy nooks, the culinary experience didn't quite meet the expectations set by its chic appearance.

On the brighter side, the beer selection was impressive and seemed well-curated, offering a range of options that satisfied my quest for a unique brew. The staff was friendly and attentive, ensuring that my glass never ran dry. So while Modern Grove shines as a spot to grab a drink with friends, the food could benefit from a bit more attention to detail to truly match its stylish allure.

Las Vegas is known for The Strip, several miles of massive resort casinos that will do just about anything to catch a visitor's attention. City Center complex is no exception.

This ultra-modern, sleek design mixed-use area is home to the Mandarin Oriental hotel. Upon entering the MO, guests travel up to the twenty-third floor to the Sky Lobby, a refreshingly unique concept. However, the Tea Lounge is just sort of there by the check-in desk. It has all the charm of a Starbucks kiosk in any lobby in any hotel in any major city in the world. The ambiance feels somewhat disconnected from the luxurious aura of the Mandarin Oriental. While the tea selection is decent and the pastries are pleasant enough, the overall experience lacks distinctiveness. It feels like an afterthought in an otherwise meticulously curated space. This spot has potential, but currently, it’s more functional than it is memorable, which is a missed opportunity given the hotel's reputation.

Conveniently placed close to the airport, rental car service also close by with big rooms that are clean and come with basic needs.\n\nI came in with my mother to the lobby where our room had already been reserved, showed proof and was given our two room keys and directions to our room. We took our car around back and was able to park right in front of our hotel room. \n\nThe basic room was spacious, with two Queen sized beds, bathroom/shower, TV, refrigerator, of course AC and wi-fi. We loved our experience at this hotel. The check-in process was smooth and efficient, which was a relief after our long flight. The proximity to the airport and rental car service made our arrival and departure hassle-free. 

The room was impeccably clean, and the beds were comfortable, providing a restful night's sleep. We appreciated the thoughtful amenities like the refrigerator and reliable Wi-Fi, which made our stay more convenient. The air conditioning worked perfectly, maintaining a comfortable temperature throughout our visit.

The staff was friendly and attentive, always ready to assist with any questions or requests. Additionally, the ease of parking right outside our room was a great perk, especially when unloading our luggage.

Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations, making it an excellent choice for travelers looking for convenience, comfort, and value. We would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the area and look forward to staying here again on future trips.

Came here with my boyfriend last weekend for a Living Social deal we got, which was a total steal! It was $199 for Friday 3pm - Sunday 1pm in a suite with a King Size bed (plus 100 bucks towards the spa, 2 free breakfast buffets, and 6 free bowling games). Didn't really know what to expect because we've never stayed anywhere in Vegas except for the strip.

Overall, we were pleasantly surprised that this place was pretty nice! The hotel itself is pretty modern and luxurious for the price we paid. The room was spacious and immaculate, with a comfortable king-sized bed and a view that was unexpectedly delightful. The staff were friendly and attentive, making our stay even more enjoyable. We took full advantage of the complimentary breakfast buffets, which offered a great variety of delicious options. The spa credit was a bonus, allowing us to unwind and relax. The bowling games provided an extra dose of fun. We’d definitely return!

Seriously if you have not been here yet - get in your car and get over there. I went because it got good reviews, it was new to me and it was Mexican food which was what I wanted today. Big surprise - fantastic food.

The restaurant is not in a swanky neighborhood but don't let that stop you. They are in a shopping center that has several other restaurants, some closed, and a sports bar. Look for it because it is not obvious.

From the pictures on Yelp, you might think they do not have many tables, but once you're inside, you'll find a cozy, welcoming space that feels like a hidden gem. The service was incredibly friendly and attentive, making me feel right at home. I tried the carne asada tacos, and they were nothing short of amazing - perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The homemade salsa was the cherry on top, bursting with fresh flavors. This place is authentic, affordable, and absolutely worth the trip.

This is probably one of the most disappointing meals we've had from a chef of this high caliber. Perhaps because the restaurant is newly opened and the menu hasn't been perfected (well, that is still no excuse for overcooking beef)? Unlike the other low-rating reviewer, service was really good for us. Ambiance and table seating and arrangement were also not an issue. The only problem we had was entirely on the food. I like the different tasting dishes but sometimes it felt really disjointed and confused, as if each dish was crafted by a different chef with no cohesive vision in mind. The beef, supposedly the star of the meal, was overdone and lacked the tenderness one would expect from such a place. The flavors didn’t meld together harmoniously, leaving us perplexed rather than delighted. For a restaurant brimming with potential, I hope they refine their culinary approach soon.

This place is 3 stores in one, a restaurant, a bakery, and a meat market. I would give the restaurant 2.5 stars, the bakery 4 stars, and the meat market 5+ stars. I've only eaten at the restaurant once; my Mom and her husband love this place - so on her recommendation, a couple of friends and I went for a prime rib dinner. My friends and I are not young, but we were the youngest people there. No problem, it was 8 pm and we were starving. We each ordered the prime rib dinner which came with soup, potato, and a few sides. The prime rib was tender, but it lacked seasoning, leaving much to be desired. The ambiance was a bit outdated, catering more to an older crowd. However, the bakery was delightful with a wide range of pastries and fresh bread, while the meat market was exceptional, offering high-quality cuts and friendly service. Overall, a mixed experience, but worth it

This is close to my house when I need to pick up something in a pinch, like jasmine rice, soy sauce, or rice vinegar. Being Thai, I find that they lack a lot of Thai ingredients. Mostly pre-packaged curries and bottled sauces, and that's it. However, they do have lots of Korean and Indian items. The produce section is nice, but no kaffir lime leaves or galangal. Lemongrass shows up every now and then. They do have nice fresh veggies (herbs) like garlic, Chinese cilantro, and basil. I appreciate the variety of fresh greens available, and the quality is generally good. The store is clean and well-organized, making it easy to find what I need. The staff is friendly and willing to help if you have any questions. While it may not fulfill all my Thai cooking needs, it's a convenient stop for other Asian pantry essentials. Overall, it's a decent place for a quick grocery run.

I really don't understand why this place has gotten so many stars. It's a weird setup. First, you go in, and stand in line (McDonald's style) to order a burger and drinks. Wait staff are shuffling next to you and jostling to get by. You're standing in line being jostled on one side and have a loud kitchen on the other. You pay for your food. You sit and wait. The burgers weren't great. The meat was gummy and had the feel of biting into some gelatinous gooey meat-like substance. 

The ambiance leaves much to be desired, with blaring music that makes conversation impossible. The fries were overly salty, and the side salad was wilted. The staff seemed overwhelmed and inattentive. For the price, I expected much better quality and service. It felt like a fast-food experience with a gourmet price tag. Save your money and try one of the many other burger joints in town. This one just doesn't deliver.

This is a restaurant that has a lot of potential but right now is veryyyyyyy much missing the mark. First, if you're doing Thai, you might want to commit to the theme. I like football, but if you want to be a sports bar, be a sports bar. If you want to be a Thai restaurant, maybe play some Asian music? Now, on to the service. My girlfriend was given a plate with a hair on it. Probably our waitress’s. Glad I caught it, but you gotta be careful of that sort of thing. Only one waitress for the whole restaurant, buuuut she was doing her best to keep up with tables. The food itself was okay at best—some dishes felt more like an adaptation rather than authentic Thai cuisine. I believe with a more cohesive theme and better staffing, this place could really shine. Here’s hoping they find their footing soon.

The Thunderbird Lounge, inside the Aruba Hotel and Spa on Las Vegas Blvd. between Oakey and Charleston, is classic Vegas, but not in the typical sense. No matter how many old black & white pictures of the Rat Pack and lounge acts they paste on the walls, this isn't a classic trip back to the "glory days" of mob Vegas. Try the Plaza or Sahara for true nostalgia. The Thunderbird is more where you'd end up after Vegas stole your money, stole your lady, stole your heart but left your liver. A place where the neon lights flicker with a gritty charm, and the drinks are as strong as the stories exchanged at the bar. The crowd is eclectic, from old-timers reminiscing about their luck-filled yesterdays to hipsters soaking in the vintage vibe. The live music, a mix of local talent and hidden gems, keeps the atmosphere lively and unpredictable. It's the kind of joint where you can lose yourself, or maybe find a piece you were missing

So incredibly pricey! For the price...not sure if it's worth it. Waiter was good and we were seated so that we could look at all the people shopping outside. Our order:

Calamari: Gluten free whaaaaat? But yes, it is! Not super crispy, but definitely nice flavor though slightly bland. Sweet and sour sauce instead of traditional cocktail/marinara. Not bad.

Caesar salad: Very fresh and crispy. For the price of $13 though? It really was a slab of romaine lettuce with a dash of dressing and a sprinkle of cheese. It seemed more like an afterthought than a substantial dish. 

Overall, while the ambiance was lovely and the service commendable, the value for money just wasn't there. This restaurant seems to bank more on its location and view rather than the quality or creativity of its dishes. If you're looking to splurge on atmosphere over food, this might be your spot, but otherwise, you might want to explore other options

Overall it is a very nice park to spend time at anytime during the year. The grounds are very well taken care of and well lit at night. I think it is the nicest park I go to that has a roller hockey rink in it. My friends and I like to use the roller hockey rink but we use it to play street hockey. We normally play there either Sunday mornings or nights and Wed nights. If you want to join us and play look up Las Vegas Street Hockey on the Internet. The rink can get slippery due to some sand coming into it from the volleyball sand pit, but it's a minor issue compared to the fun we have. Aside from street hockey, the park offers plenty of amenities including walking trails, picnic areas, and a playground for kids. It's a fantastic place for families to spend the day or for individuals looking to enjoy some outdoor activities. Highly recommend checking it out!

Our first meal in Scottsdale was at Bacon--and interestingly enough bacon seemed to become the theme of our entire trip. Bacon chocolate chip cookies, bacon brittle, bacon-infused vodka, and bacon Bloody Mary's? They're all available somewhere in Scottsdale, but you can find the famous Bacon Bloody Mary here at Bacon.

This is a cool space for a breakfast spot, with indoor-outdoor seating and lots of light. Our server, who seemed to be a bit overworked since he was the only waiter, was very friendly and welcoming. We were impressed by the creativity and variety on the menu. The bacon flight is a must-try, featuring an assortment of flavors that highlight the versatility of everyone's favorite pork product. The ambiance is laid-back, perfect for starting a day of exploring in Scottsdale. Despite the busyness, our food arrived promptly and the quality was top-notch. Bacon is a unique spot worth visiting, especially if you're a bacon enthusiast looking to indulge in some culinary adventures.

It was my first time in Vegas and I went with my friend John. Now John is a Vegas junkie; usually, he travels out there in November and March every year. He loves hitting the strip during March Madness. Anyway, he had found a deal at his travel agent. He booked us two different deals: one was at Treasure Island, which included airfare. The other deal was two days and three nights at the Stratosphere, free. When you checked in, they gave you 100 dollars in free slot play, 50 bucks cash, and a free buffet.

Our stay at Treasure Island was fantastic, with great amenities and a lively atmosphere. However, the highlight was the Stratosphere. The views from the top were absolutely breathtaking. The 100 dollars in free slot play was a fun bonus, and the buffet offered a delicious variety of dishes. For a first-time Vegas experience, this trip set a high standard. Thanks to John, I'm already planning my next visit!

I visited with my family for an early dinner on Saturday and was very impressed. We were the only ones there so early, and only one other guest arrived while we were eating, so I would say that reservations are not necessary until later in the evening.\n\nWe started with a platter of three hummuses - sun-dried tomato, kalamata olive, and black bean, accompanied with triangles of pita and some fresh veggies. The sun-dried tomato hummus was by far our favorite, but the others were delicious as well. The flavors were vibrant and complemented the fresh pita perfectly. For our main courses, we ordered a variety of dishes to share: lamb kebabs, stuffed grape leaves, and a classic moussaka. The lamb was tender and juicy, seasoned to perfection with a delightful mix of spices. The grape leaves were delicate yet packed with flavor, and the moussaka was a comforting, savory indulgence with its creamy béchamel topping.

The service was attentive without being intrusive, and our server was knowledgeable, happily answering our questions about the menu. The ambiance was cozy and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a family meal. The restaurant is clearly a hidden gem, offering both quality food and a pleasant dining experience. Despite the light crowd during our visit, I can see how this place could become a bustling favorite for locals. We left satisfied and eager to return to try more of their enticing menu.

I just had the absolute worst experience checking in. I've been here for 10 minutes and I'm already leaving this review, which I've never done before. Juaquine Lopes at the front desk should be terminated. After waiting in one line for 15 minutes to check in, he opens up a second line telling everyone behind us to go in front of us. I waited another 25 minutes to check in, only to be told by him that I was in the wrong line to begin with and it's my fault (every other person in my line was there to check in as well). His attitude was condescending and unapologetic, which only added to the frustration. A simple acknowledgment of the mistake would have sufficed, but instead, he chose to be dismissive. The lack of organization and professionalism at this establishment is disappointing. I hope management addresses these issues promptly to prevent future mishaps for other guests.

Went to this location this morning because we found some extra cash in the car before work, never will I ever stop at this location AGAIN. Or for McDonald's for that matter. My partner and I walked into the establishment & each ordered a meal to eat inside. We went to go get our refreshments, as we were waiting, three of the employees were staring at us then would look back at each other and laugh. As our food was called, my partner went to go get it. I watched the three younger Hispanic guys watch my partner reach for the tray and yet again giggle amongst themselves. It was incredibly uncomfortable and felt disrespectful. The food was standard for McDonald's, but the unprofessional behavior from the staff completely ruined our experience. We didn't feel welcome and left without finishing our meal. Customer service should be a priority, and unfortunately, this location failed miserably in that department.

So, I have never actually taken the time to sit down and put pen to paper or even a single finger to keyboard for a review. Really, what I'm saying is, I'm pretty lazy, so for me to even write a review, means you should probably heed my statements... or not, it's sort of a free country (still)...

My wife and I went to "Down Under" a few nights ago because a friend of ours had high recommendations. We walked in, sat where we wanted, and were handed two menus, a wine list, and a warm welcome from our server. The ambiance was delightfully Australian-themed, cozy yet vibrant. The menu, filled with authentic Aussie dishes, was a delight to peruse. I opted for the kangaroo steak, which was cooked to perfection—tender and flavorful. My wife chose the barramundi, which was equally impressive, with a delightful mix of spices. Our server was attentive without being intrusive. Overall, "Down Under" provided

Okay, I came to this place a lot for karaoke last year. It was fun cause I could take off my shirt and stuff and no one cared. They also had bar bingo which was a sure-fire way to get drunk for under $15. Recently, a lot of friends were raving about the pizza, which I have had a few times before. I remember it being what I call "bar pizza". Pizza that is doughy and fluffy, tastes good when you are sober but even better when you are drunk, however at the end of the night, you might find yourself wondering if it was really the pizza or the beer talking. Nevertheless, I decided to give it another go, and I must say, they've upped their game. The crust was perfectly crisp, and the toppings were generous and flavorful. It’s still the perfect companion for a fun night out, whether you're belting out your favorite tunes or trying to win that bar bingo. Highly recommend for a laid-back evening with

Claim Jumper continues to be my all-round favourite restaurant in the US. First time I ate at one in California I was blown away by the portion size (so big that they were serving apples on the plates) and also by the taste of the food. Their prime rib is absolutely delicious, and second favourite of mine is the rotisserie chicken - especially with their barbecue sauce. In fact, if you get any steak there, get that BBQ sauce and slather it on - it's wonderful.

Varied menu, giant portions, reasonable price, consistently excellent service – what more could you ask for? The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a rustic charm that makes you feel right at home. Whether you're there for a family gathering or a casual dinner, the staff always makes sure you're well taken care of. Don't forget to leave room for their decadent desserts; the Chocolate Motherlode Cake is a must-try. Claim Jumper truly embodies the spirit of hearty American dining.

Stopped in here on Saturday with G money. The host was pretty cool in finding us a table around the bar so we didn't have to go up and down any steps. Our server, Alysha (sp?) was one of the best servers I think I've ever had. If you've ever been to Applebees before you know the menu is pretty standard, but with a few cool dishes thrown in. The drink menu also has some nice looking selections on it. I'm not totally crazy about fruity drinks but the red apple sangria looked and sounded good. If I had to recommend anything, it would definitely be that. G money tried the classic burger and raved about how perfectly it was cooked. I decided to go with the Fiesta Lime Chicken, and it was deliciously tangy and well-seasoned. Our food arrived quickly, and Alysha made sure we had everything we needed without being intrusive. The atmosphere was lively, yet not too loud, which made it easy to have a conversation. The overall vibe was welcoming and relaxed, making it a perfect spot for a casual night out. We wrapped up our meal with the Triple Chocolate Meltdown, and it was the perfect sweet ending to our evening. Overall, the combination of great service, tasty food, and a chill environment made for a really enjoyable experience. We'll definitely be back!

I've shopped here for years, but had a recent bad experience. Planning a party and ordering the food should not be such a hostile experience. Their ad says they can have the food ready for catering in 2 days, I showed up to order over a week before the event was due--in total 9 days prior. I waited a long time only to be greeted by Emily who was upset her lunch was interrupted (it was 1:30) and I did apologize for taking her away from her meal, but she was clearly not happy. She made us wait longer for her to finish eating, which felt unprofessional. When we finally got to placing the order, she seemed rushed and inattentive, which made me concerned about how they would handle my catering needs. I've always loved their food, but this experience left me questioning their customer service. I hope they address this issue, as their quality and reputation are at stake.

For those of you who only read partial reviews--this review is about Guitar Center as a COMPANY and not this individual location. I admit that outright.\n\nI usually give 4s and 5s. I'm one of those people who has positive things to say about just about anywhere...but not here. Don't get me wrong--I have no problem with this individual location. I have been trying to order something site-to-store from the parent company website for three days. First, they advertised it as one price but as soon as it went into my cart , the price mysteriously increased by 20%. I thought it might be a glitch, so I refreshed the page, but the issue persisted. I then spent over an hour trying to reach customer service, only to be stuck in an endless loop of automated messages and hold music. When I finally managed to speak to a representative, they seemed more interested in upselling me than addressing my concerns. The whole experience was frustrating and felt disorganized. I expected a company as established as Guitar Center to have a smoother online shopping process and better customer service. While the in-store staff at this location have always been helpful and knowledgeable, my experience with the corporate side has left a lot to be desired. It’s disappointing to see such a disconnect between the in-store experience and the online service.

Beware Tourist Trap! 5th time in Vegas and this place so far has been the worst experience in service & food quality! 

1st star off: Unatentive "Pretty Princess" Waitress (other reviewers seemed to have problems with the staff), the "busboy" had a better attitude and was 10 times more attentive than her.

2nd star off: Do yourself a favor and save your money and don't order any of their "signature" 30+ dollars drink (the daiquiries were laughably weak and tasted more like melted ice with a splash of artificial flavoring). 

3rd star off: The food was another letdown. The pasta was overcooked and the sauce tasted like it came straight out of a can. A $25 meal should scream quality, but this was more of a whimper.

4th star off: Ambiance was more chaotic than charming, with loud music blaring, making it hard to enjoy even a conversation

The best buffet in town! We paid $34/person, kinda pricey... at least compared to all the other buffets in town, but it's definitely worth the money. And kids 12 and under pay half ($17), whereas other buffet places, such as Bellagio, you have to pay full price for kids.

The food selections are great... not too overwhelming like some other places where it has all kinds of dishes for all types of cuisines, but most of them you won't even bother to touch or try anyway. This place has enough selections of well-curated dishes that cater to various palates without going overboard. The carving station is a standout with perfectly cooked prime rib and tender grilled chicken. The dessert station offers decadent treats like mini cheesecakes and chocolate mousse that end the meal on a sweet note. The staff is attentive, ensuring that tables are clean and drinks are refilled promptly. If you're looking for quality over sheer quantity, this buffet is the spot to visit.

CHEAP! STINGY! MISERABLE! 

After all day of walking around on the Strip, I was starved. We found Fleur by chance as we explored Mandalay Bay. My BF wasn't very hungry, so he chose something from the "small plate" section of the menu, which, as it was explained to us, was similar to Tapas style. Since I was very hungry, I ordered "slow cooked salmon" from the "large plate" section of the menu. 

When the orders arrived, I was shocked at the portion sizes. My BF's small plate was barely a few bites, and my "large plate" was laughably tiny. The salmon was delicious but hardly enough to satisfy my hunger. For the price, I expected more than a meager serving that left me still craving a proper meal. The atmosphere was lovely, but the portions left much to be desired. Not a place I'd recommend if you're looking to actually fill up.

When your tennis instructor has you and 8 others hitting balls for 2-and-a-half-hours in the 105 degree heat at Freedom Park, the last thing I wanted was a greasy burger or stir fry, or pizza. My body was craving hydration and something fresh and cold.

Instead of our usual apres-tennis East Boulevard lunch haunts, my husband and I checked out Something Classic Cafe. (Home of the gourmet TV dinner which I will get to in a moment.)

I got the salad trio with the chicken, quinoa, and kale salads, and it was exactly what I needed. Each salad was flavorful and light, and the ingredients tasted incredibly fresh. The chicken was perfectly cooked, not dry at all, and the quinoa salad had a delightful hint of lemon that brightened up the whole plate. My husband tried the classic BLT, which came with a side of homemade chips that were crispy and not overly salty. 

As for the gourmet TV dinner, we grabbed one for later, and

Unlike others, I did not find the owner friendly. I found him to be a bag of douche of galactic proportions.\n\nI suppose this place is OK for average bikes needing average repairs, but when I brought in my road bike for a repair of moderate difficulty for any competent bike shop, because the owner was incapable of doing the repair he chose to insult me by telling me I should sell my bike and get something more appropriate for someone of my physique. \n\nAt the moment I'm a little overweight, but here's the facts: every summer I road bike across the state, and I've been doing this for five years without any issues. I take pride in my biking skills and maintain my equipment meticulously. The owner's dismissive attitude and lack of professionalism were disappointing, to say the least. 

The shop itself is cluttered and disorganized, with tools scattered haphazardly and a general lack of cleanliness. While the staff seemed knowledgeable enough, they were overshadowed by the owner's rude demeanor. 

To his credit, the shop does carry a decent selection of basic bike accessories and the prices are reasonable, but that's where the positives end for me. If you're looking for a place that values customer service and respect, this isn’t the shop for you. I left feeling undervalued and disheartened, and I won't be returning anytime soon.

Do you love a good waffle? Yes. Then Waffles Incaffeinated is for you. Not a huge waffle fan? Enjoy a more savory breakfast? Then Waffles Incaffeinated is for you too! This menu has something for everyone. The girls and I recently headed down to Waffles INC for our monthly brunch on a beautiful Saturday morning in the burgh. Southside was just starting to become busy as people slowly awoke from their alcohol-induced slumber and meandered outside to start their day. For those of you who were never SS residents, it was 11 AM, and the neighborhood was buzzing with life.

As we entered, the aroma of sweet and savory waffles welcomed us warmly. I opted for the "Wake Up Call," which had a perfect blend of crispy bacon and fluffy waffles, while my friends tried the "Veggie Delight" and "Nutty Professor." Each dish was deliciously satisfying. The service was attentive, and the ambiance was cozy and inviting. Highly

OMG... I was in food heaven! :) My friend and I decided to give this place a try because we were hearing such good things about it and about their vegan options. So this is what we ordered and shared:

1st dish: Tofu and Soy Chorizo burrito... oh man, this was awesome. The burrito was perfectly spiced and tasty. I'm sure that any non-vegan would have never guessed that this was a vegan dish... it was that good. The chorizo was da bomb! The dish even came with tofu that was cooked to perfection, adding a delightful texture and rich flavor that balanced the spices wonderfully.

We also tried their Vegan Nachos, which were a symphony of flavors with creamy cashew cheese, fresh guacamole, and a surprisingly tangy salsa that kept us coming back for more. The ambiance was cozy, and the service was attentive, making the entire experience memorable. Highly recommend to vegans and non-vegans alike!

This was one of the few places we found open on Christmas day and we went for dinner. Even though the place was packed and there was a line out the door, we were seated in less than 10 minutes and the service was excellent.\n\nHaving lived in New Mexico for about 5 years, I've learned a lot about green chile. I've also learned that more often than not, when you visit a restaurant serving green chile outside of New Mexico, their idea of \""hot\"" is what we would call less than mild in NM. So, I wasn't expecting much when I saw green chile on the menu at this bustling little spot. However, I was pleasantly surprised! The green chile here had a kick that was genuinely reminiscent of authentic New Mexican spice. It was rich, flavorful, and perfectly complemented my enchiladas.

The ambiance was warm and inviting, with festive decorations adding a cozy touch to our holiday meal. Despite the crowd, our waiter was attentive, making sure our drinks were topped up and that we had everything we needed. The menu offered a delightful variety of options, catering to both traditional tastes and those looking for something a bit different.

Overall, the experience was a wonderful surprise. If you're searching for a place that serves up a taste of the Southwest with genuine warmth and hospitality, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit. We're already planning to return for another flavorful adventure!

This was my second time at the Trump and I am please again. I appreciate that this hotel is simply a hotel and not a casino.... My stay was quiet, smoke-free, and restful. The prices are so reasonable! The walk from valet to the lobby check-in to the elevator is accessible and not a journey through a casino or to the other side of the hotel. If you're ready to go out on the town and need a taxi, the bell boy will happily and quickly hail one for you immediately. \n\nThe rooms are amazing! Each room feels like a luxurious retreat, complete with modern amenities and elegant decor. The spacious layout includes a comfortable sitting area, a well-equipped kitchenette, and a plush bed that guarantees a good night's sleep. The bathroom is a highlight, with a deep soaking tub and high-quality toiletries that add a touch of indulgence to your stay.

The staff at the Trump are exceptional, providing attentive and friendly service without being intrusive. Whether you need restaurant recommendations or assistance with your luggage, they are always eager to help. The location is convenient, offering easy access to all the major attractions without the hustle and bustle usually associated with a casino hotel.

Overall, this hotel offers a perfect blend of luxury, convenience, and tranquility. It's the ideal choice for travelers seeking a relaxing stay without the noise and distractions of a casino environment. I look forward to my next visit!

This place is a real gem for those who like to geek out or are true history buffs (that would include my son and husband). We took a visit to Vegas with the family and really wanted to check this place out. We got in here with a Groupon which was $48 for the whole family (5 people) plus access to Area 51.

There are two areas in this exhibit - Area 51 and the National Atomic Testing Museum (NATM). Area 51 is all about extraterrestrial life and aliens. There are cheesy electronic sounds, alien dolls, and some news articles that give it a fun, kitschy vibe, which my son found utterly fascinating. The NATM, on the other hand, offers a captivating journey through the history of atomic testing. The realistic artifacts, detailed narratives, and engaging exhibits shed light on a significant part of history. The staff was knowledgeable and eager to answer questions. It's definitely a unique experience that's both entertaining and educational, making it a must-visit

So... I don't live in Montreal but I relied on this grocery store to supply me with some breakfasts, lunches and snacks, while I was visiting from Boston. Not being from the area, I am not sure how well priced the groceries are here, but most things seemed pretty over-priced (at least compared to similar grocery stores in the Boston area). I was seriously in shock over the price of the M&Ms. Almost $5 for a small bag?! They have their own President's Choice brand, which was more reasonable than name brands and the items that I tried were quite good. The store was clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful, which made navigating an unfamiliar grocery store much easier. They offered a decent selection of fresh produce, and I was pleasantly surprised by the variety of local cheeses available - a definite perk for a cheese lover like me! The layout was straightforward, making it easy to find everything I needed. I particularly appreciated their ready-made food section, which provided delicious and convenient options for a traveler on the go. However, if you're on a budget, you might want to compare prices at a few different places. All in all, it was a convenient spot to stock up on essentials during my stay, despite the sticker shock on certain items.

My experience was poor. I was so excited to try this place after seeing and hearing so many good things. When I arrived the hostess was rude and pretended that I didn't exist until she realized that I wasn't going away. We were sat quite quickly, but it took nearly 15 minutes before our waiter came to take a drink order. I ordered ne of their signature drinks and was pleased when it arrived. Our waiter brought out bread and herb butter, but the butter was nearly frozen and impossible to spread over the cold bread. I was a little taken back by the pricing on the menu, considering the quality of service we were receiving. When our entrees finally arrived, they were lukewarm, as if they had been sitting out for a while. The flavors were bland, and the presentation was subpar for the price point. Throughout the meal, our waiter seemed disinterested and inattentive, rarely checking in on us or refilling our drinks. I had high hopes for dessert but was once again disappointed by a dry, overly sweet chocolate cake that tasted store-bought. Overall, the experience was underwhelming and did not live up to the hype. I left feeling unsatisfied and frustrated, especially considering the cost. I hope they can address these issues, as they have potential, but I won't be returning anytime soon.

I want to start off saying that I love dogs! I have two of my own so of course when I found out that this was being built directly across from the school I work at, I was there for the grand opening and several times since. There are two gated areas, one for small dogs and one for big dogs. I have to go to the small dog one as I have 2 small dogs.

I gave it 4 stars because there is always a shortage of waste bags when I go and it is a little smaller than I would have liked. My dogs don't mind too much, but I do wish they had a bit more room to run around and play. However, it's a fantastic spot for socializing, and the agility equipment is a nice touch. The staff is friendly and always around to ensure a safe environment. Overall, it's a valuable addition to our community.

On our recent trip to Vegas from the New England, we were craving ramen. Having lived in Hawaii and Los Angeles, and frequenters of Ippudo in New York, you can consider us ramen fiends. 

FOOD - We ordered tonkotsu ramen and tonkotsu-shoyu ramen (it's NOT "tonKATsu," people!), gyoza, kimchi fried rice, pork belly bowl, and mini mentaiko bowl. Yes, a lot of food for 3, but everything was absolutely divine. The tonkotsu ramen was richly flavored with a creamy broth that boasted the perfect balance of umami. The pork belly was melt-in-your-mouth tender, adding an extra layer of indulgence. The gyoza were crispy and perfectly seasoned, providing a delightful contrast to the ramen. The kimchi fried rice was a spicy, tangy revelation. The mini mentaiko bowl brought a burst of flavor with its delicate, briny notes.

The wait for a walk in was 2 hours. I just came in for an x ray because my wisdom teeth were coming in. I figured it was going to be a easy visit but then they talked me into extracting a tooth by saying it would only cost $93, I don't know there are complications so that will be $165. I figure what the hell I'm already here I already waited might as well go through with it... Bad idea. \nKeep in mind these are dental students not actual dentists, so they really are not that experienced especially when it came to the The wait for a walk-in was 2 hours. I just came in for an X-ray because my wisdom teeth were coming in. I figured it was going to be an easy visit, but then they talked me into extracting a tooth by saying it would only cost $93. I don't know, there are complications, so that will be $165. I figure what the hell, I'm already here, I already waited, might as well go through with it... Bad idea.

Keep in mind, these are dental students, not actual dentists, so they really are not that experienced, especially when it came to the extraction process. The procedure felt rushed and uncoordinated. The student seemed uncertain and had to consult with a supervisor multiple times, which didn’t instill confidence. There was a lot of discomfort during the extraction, and the numbing wasn’t sufficient. Overall, it was a stressful and painful experience that I wouldn't recommend. If you need dental work, it’s worth the extra

Reviewing just the casino. And that's quite enough. Researching my trip to death, a common theme was to check out "the places where the locals go." Promises of loose slots, friendlier dealers, food deals, lower table minimums, etc.

Mrs. H. and I were just driving around, took the left off of LVB onto Sahara, and bumped into Palace Station.

Me: "Oh yeah!....,these are the joints I've been hearing about! These are the hidden gems!"

Walking into Palace Station, we immediately felt the local vibe. The slot machines were indeed looser, and I felt like we had stepped into a place with genuine character. The dealers were relaxed, friendly, and seemed genuinely happy to chat with us as we played. Betting minimums were refreshingly low, allowing us to stretch our budget while still enjoying the action. The food deals were a pleasant surprise, offering tasty options without breaking the bank. Overall, Palace Station delivered exactly what we

Want the absolute worst waxing experience ever? Go here. Seriously, I've NEVER had an experience like the one I had a few weeks ago.

I went in on a Sunday morning and from the very first moment was barraged with three different people trying to get me to 1) realize I need to wax every three weeks or else and 2) should be signing up for a waxing package immediately. So I was already pretty turned off before I even got in the waxing room.

But then the real "fun" started. I was shocked at how unprofessional the waxing technician was. She seemed rushed and distracted, which did not inspire confidence. The room wasn’t as clean as I would expect, and the wax was scalding hot. I mentioned it felt too hot, but she assured me it was normal. It wasn't. The end result? Patchy and uneven, and I left with irritated skin that took days to calm down. Safe to say, I won’t be going back.

Best Buffet in Las Vegas. Period. My only dislike about this place is the lack of good seafood choices. The sushi was pretty fresh, and the clams/mussels/shrimp bar is a neat and delicious idea. The trout salad, salty fishy crostini, and seared salmon were alright, but the crab left something to be desired. As a huge crab-bie, that was a bit disappointing!

All that aside, everything else was pretty darn good for buffet food. The Tomato/Corn Risotto was rich and flavorful, and the Angry Mac n' Cheese added a perfect kick. The lamb was tender and cooked to perfection, which was honestly a surprise for a buffet setting. The dessert selection was the cherry on top, with a wide array of decadent pastries and creamy gelato. With attentive staff and a vibrant atmosphere, this buffet offers a delightful dining experience. Just a little more attention to the seafood, and it’d be perfect!

We are staying at the MGM Grand for a conference and I wanted to have my first Thomas Keller experience. Unfortunately maybe I should have waited till I could get to San Fran or NYC. This restaurant is very difficult to find at the Venetian. We arrived at 8:30PM on Sunday night without a reservation and were seated right away, which was nice. \n\nSalad choices were disappointing with a chevre chaud served on mixed greens rather than mache, so I went for an endive and watercress with roquefort. Good dressing although slightly overpowering, which overshadowed the delicate flavors of the greens. For the main course, I opted for the roasted chicken, expecting a masterpiece given Keller's reputation. Sadly, it was underwhelming. The chicken was tender, but the seasoning lacked the depth and complexity I anticipated. 

My dining partner chose the beef short ribs, which were much better. They were succulent and well-cooked, paired perfectly with the accompanying root vegetables. The ambiance was pleasant, with an elegant yet relaxed vibe, but the service was hit-or-miss. Our server was attentive but seemed rushed, perhaps due to the late hour. 

Dessert was the saving grace. The chocolate mousse was decadent and luxurious, a sweet end to an otherwise middling experience. Overall, while the restaurant offered glimpses of brilliance, it didn't fully live up to the high expectations associated with Keller's name. Perhaps next time, I'll make a reservation at one of his signature locations.

Bought many items at Fry's Electronics but never ever again. Worst experience ever regarding service and repair. Computer was purchased not quite two years ago with warranty on it. Needed service as hard drive supposedly crashed. Well, after 3 weeks of supposed service and transfer, my computer was trash. Windows 7 was corrupt, only a portion of files transferred, and the programs that were on the computer when I purchased it, which is why I purchased that one, are no longer on it. So in addition to paying the $70.00 transfer service, I had to pay another $200.00 to a local technician to try and fix what Fry's had messed up. The customer service was equally disappointing; I was met with indifference and lack of accountability. I expected much more from a reputable electronics store, but this experience has left me frustrated and out of pocket. I won't be returning to Fry's for any future purchases or repairs.

What a disappointment! I went to Aureole Las Vegas for my sister's birthday dinner. I checked it out online and it sounded amazing. She said yes and so VEGAS HERE WE COME!! Saturday night our party of 8 get to what we thought would be a fabulous dinner. We are taken to our table and are rudely greeted by our waiter. He quickly tells us about their wines and walks away. We flag him down and ask for the sommelier. Our waiter comes back after several minutes and takes our drink order. Drinks were great but after that, the service fell apart.

We waited almost an hour for our entrees. When they finally arrived, some dishes were cold, and others weren't what we ordered. The waiter seemed overwhelmed and uninterested in our concerns. The ambiance was lovely, but the service left a lot to be desired. For a place with such a reputation, we expected more. Unfortunately, it did not live up to the hype.

Decided to run in here, because it's close, for a quick sushi dinner and afterwards, we wished we hadn't. They were NOT nice to us, it was like we were inconveniencing them, even though there were many many empty tables.

So... as we are talking with the hostess, working on being seated, some snooty chick comes up, interrupts and says, "um, we need to be seated NOW." The hostess then asks, "Is your party all here?" (which is necessary when you reserve a table), but the interrupter just nodded dismissively. To our astonishment, they were immediately taken to a table, while we continued to wait.

When we finally got a seat, service remained lackluster. The sushi was forgettable at best, with limp fish and rice that wasn’t properly vinegared. Overall, the experience was a disappointment. The atmosphere was cold, and the service was inattentive. We left feeling unappreciated and uns

Was in Vegas for the weekend for Punk Rock Bowling and wanted to check out the fight. I searched for somewhere showing the fight and came across this $10 UFC viewing party. My group decided to check it out and was very disappointed. For $10 you get to stand in a short line that takes forever because there are security guards frisking you and ruffling through your pockets and belongings. You then proceed to the ballroom where the seats are arranged in a clever circular octagon formation, facing several large screen projectors. It looked cool until you try to find a seat and realize that the space is incredibly cramped. It was nearly impossible to squeeze past people without bumping into them, and the lack of personal space made it uncomfortable to settle in and enjoy the fight. The screens, while large, had a lot of glare which made it difficult to see the action clearly. The sound quality was subpar, too, with echoes and muffled commentary that made it hard to follow what was happening in the matches.

The saving grace was the enthusiastic crowd, which brought some energy to an otherwise lackluster setup. However, the overpriced snacks and drinks left a sour taste, making the overall experience feel like a cash grab rather than a genuine fan event. For $10, I expected a bit more than just the opportunity to stand in a crowded room. I wouldn’t recommend it unless they make significant improvements.

The Lost Dog Wash Trail and I (as well as Bry and our two labradors) had the pleasure of meeting each other at the end of April. Even at a little after 8am, there was a freak storm hovering nearby so we had some concerns with "surviving" the trail and getting back in time before getting fully rained on. To our relief, the hike was easy as pie and had little elevation gain, but we did encounter one small problem. We were talking and missed a turn and ended up adding another trail and a half or so to our loop. Despite our detour, the trail was well-maintained and offered stunning desert views, particularly with the dramatic storm clouds adding a unique backdrop. The signage could be clearer, but the friendly fellow hikers we met along the way were more than happy to help redirect us. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, and our labradors loved every moment, especially the extra mileage!

I didn't stay here, just visited opening weekend to see what it was like... And I was very underwhelmed. The broken elevators and the crowds, definitely expected that kind of thing for opening. There are growing pains.

What I didn't expect was the layout and design of this place. It was perfectly "meh." Being the first opening of a major resort and casino since I've moved here, I was excited to see what it would be like. I really didn't like the design, and left confused about how they could have missed the mark so entirely. The decor felt dated rather than fresh and innovative, and the overall ambiance seemed lackluster. Areas that should have been inviting and exciting felt instead like an afterthought. Additionally, the signage was inadequate, making navigation a challenge. For a new establishment, it lacked the charm and excitement that should accompany a grand opening. Hopefully, with time, they’ll tweak and improve the experience, but I won’t be rushing back soon.

The ambiance is lovely and many of the dishes above average but the service was so terrible, it can guarantee you'll have a bad night... so why bother?

Everything started off fine even though the wait for a table ended up not being the "10 minutes" they promised but well over 30 minutes. They sit you down and get your order and everything seems fine. And then you wait. Over 45 minutes later, without a peep from our waitress to check in and let us know what is going on, they dump food on our table. 

The food, while good, was not enough to mask the frustration of poor service. We had to flag down staff multiple times just to get water refills or to ask for the check. It was clear they were understaffed, but a little communication would have gone a long way in making the experience more bearable. Sadly, the lack of attention and care overshadowed what could have been a delightful evening.

I won't write much here, as I don't really do franchise reviews...and, actually, I've already written a review for another Sprouts location (or two? I don't remember and can't be bothered to check...). So, if you want a better run down on Sprouts, in my eyes, having shopped there for almost 5 years, please check my profile. For now, this is a quick run down of this location.

On the downside, some of their stock is different than what we'd grown accustomed to in Salt Lake City. Certain specialty items and local favorites are missing, which can be disappointing for those of us who enjoy consistency. However, the produce section is still top-notch, offering fresh, organic options that make up for it. The staff here is attentive and friendly, ready to help with a smile. Parking is a breeze, which is always a bonus. Overall, it's a solid spot but with minor tweaks needed to match the Sprouts experience I love.

Whoever goes to this place is out of their mind. Depended on Yelp for reviews, and supposedly they do a great job. Spent 300 the night before for a beautiful ombre and decided to go in for a quick small trim to freshen up my hair. Well, now my hair is in a bun because it looks horrible. Money down the drain for the next few weeks until I go and have to spend another 300 for a new ombre since half of mine was cut off. The girl cutting my hair was a really nice girl, but when I called to speak to a manager about the situation, they were dismissive and offered no solution or apology. It's incredibly frustrating to have invested so much in my hair only to have it ruined. I will not be returning and caution others against trusting the reviews. Customer service is clearly not a priority here, and I deeply regret my visit.

I went here tonight with the BF. We thought it was really meh, capital MEH. We had a reservation, but for some reason got sat inside. There were virtually no people eating inside and outside was lively and had a band playing... we couldn't even hear it inside... it was like silent. I would think they would at least open the doors, but nope. So that was a bad start. It took our waitress a long time to even come to our table, and when she came she asked if we wanted drinks and apps (which we didn't given the vibe). The ambiance inside felt like an afterthought compared to the lively atmosphere outside. We ordered entrées, hoping the food would make up for things. It was just okay, nothing remarkable. Service was slow, and it felt like we were forgotten at times. Overall, it wasn't the experience we were hoping for, and we left feeling underwhelmed. Not sure we'll be coming back.

Sadly in the year and a half since I first wrote my review things have changed a bit at Cafe, and not for the best. More and more my coworkers and I are experiencing regular problems with this place, that is when we're brave enough to risk ordering from Cafe now.\n\nFirstly, there's the problems with the orders. It honestly doesn't seem to matter if we order right off the menu or if we ask for a small change to our order - something basic will always be missing (like lettuce) or done incorrectly when the food arrives. Sadly, in the year and a half since I first wrote my review, things have changed a bit at Cafe, and not for the best. More and more, my coworkers and I are experiencing regular problems with this place, that is when we're brave enough to risk ordering from Cafe now.

Firstly, there's the problems with the orders. It honestly doesn't seem to matter if we order right off the menu or if we ask for a small change to our order - something basic will always be missing (like lettuce) or done incorrectly when the food arrives. This inconsistency has become a frustrating norm.

Moreover, the service has noticeably declined. What used to be friendly, attentive staff has become a hurried, indifferent experience. Wait times have increased, even during non-peak hours.

The quality of the food, once a reliable highlight, now fluctuates wildly. Some days it's decent, others it's barely palatable. It's disappointing to see a once-great spot lose its charm. Hopefully, Cafe will address

Probably should give this one star, but can't bring myself to go that low. The restaurant offers a huge buffet that is thoughtfully laid out, allowing ample room to maneuver around without bumping into other patrons. The buffet was impeccably maintained; I never saw an empty dish, which was impressive. The staff deserves a nod for their friendliness and efficiency—they were quick to clear plates and refill drinks.

However, the food, which is the main attraction, was largely disappointing. The sushi rolls, for example, were overwhelmed by a crab-like slaw; it seemed like every roll came with an unwelcome dollop, masking any subtle flavors the sushi might have had. Other dishes were similarly underwhelming, lacking the freshness and vibrancy you'd expect. Despite the excellent service and buffet layout, the subpar food made it difficult to fully enjoy the experience. It’s a decent place if you prioritize quantity over quality—but unfortunately, it missed the mark for me.

DO NOT HIRE THiS GUY!!!!!! This guy is an incompetent attorney. I was arrested for DUI in November of 2012 for being in proximity of my vehicle. The Charge was reduced to reckless driving due to lack of evidence. It should have been thrown out but I live in Arizona and didn't want to travel back and forth for a trial. In July of 2013 when he went to court he forgot to take my signed plea to court. No big deal, the trial was rescheduled for two weeks later. The judge orders me to take an online DUI school. A DO NOT HIRE THIS GUY!!!!!! This guy is an incompetent attorney. I was arrested for DUI in November of 2012 for being in proximity of my vehicle. The charge was reduced to reckless driving due to lack of evidence. It should have been thrown out, but I live in Arizona and didn't want to travel back and forth for a trial. In July of 2013, when he went to court, he forgot to take my signed plea to court. No big deal, the trial was rescheduled for two weeks later. The judge orders me to take an online DUI school. Additionally, his lack of organization and attention to detail was evident throughout the process. He rarely returned my calls or kept me updated on the status of my case. I felt completely in the dark about my legal standing and worried about unnecessary legal repercussions. For anyone seeking a competent and responsive attorney, I strongly advise looking elsewhere. This experience was frustrating and stressful.

I had been wanting to try this place for some time, knowing that it was esteemed chef Tom Colicchio's restaurant, and the experience was divine. The ambiance was very simplistic, not extravagant, but at the same time very elegant. Our service was excellent as well; the server was helpful with picking out a wine (I think the cheapest wine on the menu was about $44 so be prepared to spend some $$ if you plan on drinking).

The food itself was fantastic. My only complaint was that our server did not make it clear whatsoever that the portions are quite small. While beautifully presented and bursting with flavor, each dish was more of a tasting portion, leaving us a bit surprised. However, the quality of the ingredients and creativity in each dish made up for it. We particularly loved the seared scallops and the duck breast, both cooked to perfection. Overall, it's a wonderful spot for a special occasion, just be ready to order multiple courses to feel fully satisfied.

EKKKKKK! Are You Kidding ME? This Sam Woo restaurant location is RIDICULOUS! Disgusting food for a ridiculous price! 90 DOLLARS for SIX DISHES!

Came here for lunch before leaving Vegas - and obviously not a good one at all.

We were a party of 6 adults and 2 children - we ordered 6 dishes:

House Steamed Chicken with the ginger onion dipping sauce - there were barely any meat on the chicken - quite frankly it was nearly all bones and more suited for a broth than a meal. The salt and pepper shrimp was overly greasy, making it hard to enjoy. The beef chow fun was bland, while the vegetables looked like they were on life support. Plus, the sweet and sour pork was mostly batter with a whisper of meat. To top it off, the service was slow and indifferent. For the price, I expected at least decent quality. Save your money and your taste buds—find another spot!

I don't understand any decent review for this place. We met 4 other couples and this was a disaster from the beginning. First of all, the decor is hideous. It's in a strip mall, and the furniture was old and dark. The tables wobbled, and you could not walk on the old, worn-out vinyl floor without your feet sticking to the ground. They act as if this is an upscale place (based upon the menu and the prices), however, nothing could be further from the truth.

Drinks...I ordered a captain and diet, and it tasted like club soda. Clearly, there was barely any alcohol, if any at all. When we ordered appetizers, they took forever to arrive, and when they finally did, the wings were cold and soggy. The entrées were no better—overcooked and bland. Service was slow and inattentive, leaving us feeling neglected. I cannot recommend this place to anyone. It was a complete disappointment from start

Let me start off by saying I did not choose to have this company attempt to fix my clothes dryer; they were contracted by my home warranty. My trouble started last December. On 12/19/11, my dryer broke. My warranty company contracted Avalon for the repair. On the 23rd when I still hadn't heard anything from them, I called their office. I was informed they never received any notification from the warranty company. After going back and forth for a couple of hours, they scheduled a service appointment for the 28th! (Had to take time off work.)

The technician arrived late, lacking the necessary parts and tools. He promised to return the next day but didn’t show up until January 3rd, again without the right parts. After multiple frustrating calls, the dryer was finally fixed on January 10th. The lack of communication and professionalism was disheartening. If I had the choice, I’d look for a more reliable repair service.

I've driven past this place many times and always made a mental note to try it out. I had a sushi craving today and thought why the hell not?

The good: I walked in and was impressed by the decor. It was warm and inviting and the hostess was nice.

And that's where it ends.

The bad: I was seated and sat there for a good five minutes before I was even approached by a server to take my drink order. 3 of them walked right past me multiple times. And there were only a handful of tables occupied, so it wasn't even busy. When my server finally arrived, they seemed rushed and uninterested in answering my questions about the menu. The sushi, when it eventually arrived, was mediocre at best, lacking the freshness I anticipated. The rolls were loosely packed and fell apart upon picking them up. Overall, the lackluster service and subpar food left me disappointed, and I'm not sure I'll be returning anytime soon.

Am a little late on this update as it's about our Fathers Day Brunch experience and that was a few weeks ago but still felt compelled to type. Went to brunch with my wife, her sister, and their parents. The brunch menu was pretty extensive and covered an App, Entree, and Dessert for $35.

First good news. Not being a dessert person, I asked if I could sub two apps instead of one app and one dessert. "It's Father's Day, sir, absolutely no problem."

Second good news. Just about everyone at the table raved about their meals. The Eggs Benedict was perfectly cooked, with a rich, creamy hollandaise, and the seafood risotto was a standout, packed with flavor and generous portions of fresh shrimp and scallops.

The service was warm and attentive, making us feel special on this occasion. The ambiance struck the right balance between being lively and intimate, perfect for a family gathering. All in all, it was a memorable brunch that left us

When we got here there was a lot of people waiting and we checked in and sat down within 15 minutes. Not bad for a full restaurant. Once we were seated, our very attentive waitress Mary came and it was like 'BANG BANG BANG.' Seriously, she was good! She got our drinks, took our orders, brought us banana nut muffins, and about 10 minutes or less later, our food was out at our table. How awesome was that? They are really organized, or the cooks are secretly Superman or have some sort of secret powers. The dishes were piping hot and beautifully presented, bursting with flavors that delighted our taste buds. The atmosphere was lively and inviting, making it a perfect spot for a casual dinner or a special occasion. Overall, the experience was seamless, and the staff clearly knows how to manage a busy restaurant without compromising on service or quality. Highly recommend giving this place a try!

What up, Big Dog!? \n\nI'll tell you what's up, this place is my IDEAL coffee shop. Literally. Figuratively. In my dreams. In Pittsburgh. In my Pittsburgh dreams. \n\nWhy, you ask? \n\nWell, I'll list out the what's what: \n\n*A customizable OATMEAL BAR. Yes! Oatmeal with all the fixins: brown sugar, walnuts, chocolate chips, dried fruit and more....! A perfect alternative to pastries and sugary treats, What up, Big Dog!? 

I'll tell you what's up, this place is my IDEAL coffee shop. Literally. Figuratively. In my dreams. In Pittsburgh. In my Pittsburgh dreams. 

Why, you ask? 

Well, I'll list out the what's what:

*A customizable OATMEAL BAR. Yes! Oatmeal with all the fixins: brown sugar, walnuts, chocolate chips, dried fruit, and more....! A perfect alternative to pastries and sugary treats, offering a hearty and healthy start to your day. 

But wait, there's more. The coffee here is top-notch, brewed to perfection. Whether you’re an espresso aficionado or prefer a classic drip, each cup is crafted with care. The ambiance is cozy and inviting with rustic wooden tables and eclectic artwork adorning the walls. The baristas? Friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend something new. Plus, they host local artists and musicians, creating a vibrant community hub. 

In a nutshell, this

This review is strictly for purchase of a Christmas tree. I was pretty set on getting our tree from another store because it was a steal but they had run out and my heart was sad. So me and my family were on a mission to find our perfect Christmas tree, without spending a fortune on doing so.

For whatever reason, I thought I was going to be stuck shopping at a Christmas tree lot to get our tree. It never crossed my mind to come to a Nursery to get a Christmas tree but when we found out my sister-in-law got hers from Green Haven Nursery, we decided to give it a shot. The selection was surprisingly vast, with trees of all shapes and sizes, and prices that were quite reasonable. The staff was incredibly helpful, assisting us in finding a tree that would perfectly fit our living room. The whole experience was delightful, and the fresh pine scent has our home feeling like the holiday season is truly here.

I usually try to write only positive reviews of places or companies, but lately I've come across one too many bad doctors in this valley and fed up, felt compelled to describe my experience here at PHG. 

Unfortunately, it differs greatly then that of most of the other reviews. It is those other reviews that convinced me to try this place. I guess not everything works for everyone, but I wanted to share my personal experience.

Completely unimpressed with this place and Dr. Majidi. From the dingy exterior of the building to the chaotic reception area, my experience at PHG was less than ideal. The staff seemed overwhelmed, and I waited nearly an hour past my appointment time before being seen. Once inside, the consultation with Dr. Majidi felt rushed and impersonal. There was little empathy or interest in addressing my concerns, and I left feeling like just another name on a chart rather than a valued patient.

The lack of communication and attentiveness was disappointing, especially given the glowing reviews that initially drew me to this practice. I understand that healthcare providers are under immense pressure, but a little kindness and professionalism go a long way. Perhaps others have had better luck here, but my visit to PHG was frustrating and unproductive. I hope that they can improve their service to match those glowing reviews and provide a more positive experience for future patients.

This store automatically gets only one star because the worst sales associate I have ever come across has transferred from the CL store at the Palazzo to this one. I don't know her name but she's a tall, older lady with short dark hair and a European accent who has a scowl on her face at all times. She's not knowledgeable, helpful, or friendly at all and makes me feel extremely uncomfortable. Who wants to get the death stare while they are shopping or even shopping at ANOTHER store right across the way (which she has done to me multiple times)? Her presence casts a shadow over the entire shopping experience. The store itself has a decent selection, and the other staff members seem pleasant, but her negative energy is overwhelming. It's disappointing because I used to enjoy shopping here, but until there's a change in staff, I’ll be taking my business elsewhere. Avoid if you can.

Unusual for a Vietnamese restaurant, I hold this place to the same standard of cleanliness I expect from a Chinese restaurant: if it tastes good and doesn't make me sick, it's a-okay! I have grown up in Asian restaurants and really, despite all the negative reviews, this place isn't that scary! If you're looking for ambiance, well, maybe you should save this one for another day. I can't say I've ever been to a Vietnamese restaurant where the decorations blew me away. However, if you are craving some mighty decent Vietnamese cuisine, you should definitely give this place a try. The pho is flavorful, with a broth that's both rich and aromatic, and the banh mi is packed with fresh, crisp ingredients. My personal favorite is the lemongrass chicken — it's tender and perfectly seasoned. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure your water is always topped up and your needs are met. Prices are reasonable, and portions are generous, ensuring you leave with a satisfied belly. While the decor might not win any design awards, the food certainly makes up for it. So, if you can look past the modest interiors, you're in for a delightful culinary experience that will transport your taste buds straight to the streets of Vietnam. Don't let the negative reviews deter you; sometimes the best gems are hidden in the most unexpected places!

for everyone who says this place is amazing, they must be blind to true culinary technique. ok so first thing I noticed was the drab wait staff. very boring and didn't even sound excited to be at work. on another note, the menu is written well but the food did not deliver. i wanted to try the fried deviled eggs, and they were clearly warmed up in the microwave and dry. the homemade spicy aioli, was nothing more than sriracha and mayo. i understand what aioli, but is wasn't mixed well or something. then, For everyone who says this place is amazing, they must be blind to true culinary technique. Okay, so first thing I noticed was the drab wait staff. Very boring and didn't even sound excited to be at work. On another note, the menu is written well, but the food did not deliver. I wanted to try the fried deviled eggs, and they were clearly warmed up in the microwave and dry. The homemade spicy aioli was nothing more than sriracha and mayo. I understand what aioli is, but it wasn't mixed well or something. Then, I moved on to the main course, a supposed "signature" dish of the house, only to find the steak overcooked and the side vegetables underseasoned. Dessert was another letdown, with a chocolate cake that tasted like it came from a box mix. Overall, this place seems to care more about presentation than quality. Save your money and dine elsewhere for a truly memorable experience.

March of last year, the BF and I were in the midst of a cross-country move - all the way from Chapel Hill, NC to LA. The BF was especially sad as he was leaving his NC climbing crew of 7 years behind. So what better way to get together with some of his climbing friends who had also moved out west of the Mississippi? Meet up at the Red Rock Rendezvous!

A weekend of climbing clinics, swag, and events sponsored by Mountain Gear to raise cash for the Access Fund... we quickly realized it was 80% socializing and 20% climbing, but we loved every minute. The sense of community was palpable, with climbers of all levels sharing experiences and laughs under the desert sun. The clinics were insightful, and we picked up some handy tips, but it was the camaraderie and the stunning backdrop of Red Rock Canyon that truly made it unforgettable. A perfect way to start our new chapter in the West!

I am shocked that I am barely writing this review for Wildflower Bread Company since I eat here at least twice a week. I used to be obsessed with Paradise Bakery but then I met Wildflower and so I dumped them. The reason? Their ingredients! So fresh, so delicious! I've literally had everything on their menu and there is nothing that I wouldn't recommend. Isn't that hard to admit when it's not your mom's food you are having? Well anyways, another thing I love about Wildflower is that they are always giving back to the community. A few months ago, I attended one of their charity events where they donated a portion of their proceeds to a local food bank. It’s rare to find a restaurant that not only serves amazing food but also prioritizes community involvement. The staff at Wildflower Bread Company are always welcoming and attentive, making each visit a pleasant experience. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for a quick lunch or a relaxing dinner. My personal favorite is their roasted sweet potato salad—it’s a perfect blend of flavors that never disappoints. Whether you're in the mood for a hearty sandwich, a fresh salad, or one of their delectable baked goods, Wildflower has something for everyone. I'm thrilled to support a business that values quality, community, and customer satisfaction. If you haven't tried Wildflower Bread Company yet, you're truly missing out on a hidden gem.

I have never had Dim Sum until this weekend... it was a totally new experience for me. I met up with some friends in Vegas (who lived there) because I was in town (to PARTY)! They invited me to Chang's for lunch where I met them. They explained to me how it worked, but they did all the ordering because I would probably order some weird stuff. 

Now, I don't know the names of any of the stuff I ate, so I'm going to try and describe it as best as I can. We had these delightful little dumplings filled with what tasted like shrimp and some kind of green herb. Another dish was a fluffy, white bun that had a savory, sweet pork filling – mind-blowingly good! There was also a crispy spring roll that was perfectly golden and crunchy. Overall, the variety and flavors were amazing, and the experience was both fun and delicious. I can’t wait to try Dim Sum again!

I would consider myself a Whole Foods Market super fan from Michigan to North Carolina to Arizona. They are generally where I find foods I love. It's where I do most of my "healthy" shopping. I usually will only shop at other stores when I can't find what I need at a Whole Foods.

The Chandler, AZ location stands out for several reasons. Hits: Nice selection of bulk dry items, allowing me to buy just the right amount I need. The veggies and fruits are consistently fresh and high-quality, perfect for my daily smoothies and salads. I also love stocking up on spices for cooking; they have a diverse range that keeps my meals exciting. The store is always clean, and the baskets are well-maintained, which is a small but important detail that adds to the shopping experience.

Overall, this Whole Foods location keeps me coming back time and time again for its quality and variety.

I'm not one to overindulge, but when I am desirous for an adult beverage, I want the best. It was a gift for a colleague that led me back to the spirits purveyor, that until now, was always a pleasure to visit.

Far from expert in my knowledge of Canadian whiskey, I was hoping an experienced staff member of this shop might help me select the best. Unfortunately, the feeling I got was akin to interrupting a brain surgeon at work--although this one was operating on cardboard with a box cutter. Brusque and seemingly annoyed by my presence, the staff member offered little more than a grunt and a vague gesture toward the whiskey aisle. Left to my own devices, I made a guess and hoped for the best. The shop still boasts a wide selection, but a touch of customer service would certainly enhance the experience.
