I left feeling more like a nuisance than a valued customer, which is a stark departure from my previous visits.

I read some blog about a guy going off as to how great this place was. So my wife and I drove to Brossard to check it out.

The restaurant is laid out very unusually, its half a bar, pizza place and the other half is the breakfast side. When you first arrive we thought we entered the wrong place, because it was a pizza joint with no server present. Once we walked through the pizza place we entered the side of the breakfast place where some random waiter said "ya just sit anywhere". The food was so-so, lacking the excitement that the blog had promised. My eggs were overcooked, and the pancakes were dry. My wife's omelette was decent but nothing to write home about. The coffee was average, not the aromatic blend we hoped for. The ambiance was confused, and the service, though friendly, felt haphazard. Overall, it was an underwhelming experience, and not worth the drive.

One of the few places that was open for Christmas and what a unexpected present! My bar manager at Fez used to manage for the this restaraunt and suggested we all go in a group. Now, pulling into this place it looked like it would be some hole in the wall restaraunt. It was all black on the outside, so you couldn't see in and it was in a strip mall!! But let me tell ya, when you walk in there is an immediate change of heart as soon as you see the fountain waterfall in front of you. \n\nIt sets the tone for a serene and inviting atmosphere, transforming any preconceptions with its unexpected elegance. The interior is tastefully decorated with soft lighting and cozy seating, making it a perfect spot for a festive gathering. The menu was a delightful surprise, offering a diverse selection of dishes that catered to every taste.

Our group savored a variety of appetizers and entrees, each more delicious than the last. The staff was attentive and friendly, ensuring our glasses were never empty and our needs were promptly met. Our bar manager's recommendation was spot on; the creative cocktails were a highlight, perfectly complementing the flavors of our meal.

In a strip mall setting, this restaurant delivers an experience that rivals fine dining establishments. It's a hidden gem worth discovering, especially when many places are closed for the holidays. We'll surely be coming back for more memorable meals and impeccable service.

The food was fresh, well prepared and delicious. The service was friendly and attentive. Not a fan of the ambiance, but I'm not there to eat the decor.

I went on a Saturday night around 6pm; it was busy but not packed. I had samosas and they were freshly made, crispy on the outside and tender inside with a little spice. I tried the Szechuan chicken, basically fried chicken pieces with onion, green peppers and hot peppers which again were freshly made, crispy outside and tender inside.

I was looking for a place that offered authentic flavors without compromising on quality, and this place delivered. The spices were perfectly balanced, adding just the right amount of heat without being overwhelming. Although the interior could use a bit of a facelift, the food more than makes up for it. The portions were generous and reasonably priced. This is definitely a spot worth visiting if you prioritize flavor and quality over aesthetics. I'll be back for more!

The first time I came here, I recognized the lady working the counter was the lady who worked at Jenni Pho. I can't comment on the pho as my favorite dish is the dried vermicelli salad. I also ordered their 3-bean dessert. It was a good first experience which deemed for a second trip.

My second visit was not as good. Because it was a work day, I decided to use the drive-through; however, when I got to the drive-through, there was a sign that said "come inside to see the menu." This was slightly inconvenient as I was in a rush, but I decided to give it another shot. Inside, the service was slower than my first visit, and the staff seemed overwhelmed. Unfortunately, my dried vermicelli salad didn’t have the same fresh flavor I remembered. However, the 3-bean dessert was consistent and delicious. I'll give them another chance, hoping this was just an off day.

I used to love coming to Mimi's when I would be in town visiting family. It used to be crowded and we'd have to rush to beat the line. Sadly those times are done....I will not be back!\n\nWhen we got there at 6pm the place was empty. Score!?! No, its empty because it has majority gone down hill. We had 4 people and split 2 dinner for 2s and we got the baked brie also. Regarding our 5 appetizers: baked brie bleh (better not melted and not enough bread), house salad was limp and uninspired, and the calamari was chewy and overly greasy. The main courses were no better. The chicken was dry and the seasoning was overwhelmingly salty, while the pasta was bland and overcooked. It felt like the dishes were thrown together without any thought or care.

The service did nothing to redeem the experience; our server seemed disinterested and rarely checked on us. Even getting a simple water refill felt like a chore. It’s disheartening to see a place I once cherished fall so drastically in quality.

The ambiance, which was once warm and inviting, now felt tired and neglected. It's clear that Mimi’s is a shadow of its former self. There are too many other dining options in the area to settle for mediocrity. Unfortunately, the fond memories I had at Mimi’s are just that—memories. I won’t be recommending or returning to this spot anytime soon.

I went here with the high hopes that it will be my new favorite place since there are great positive reviews about it. Sadly, my hopes were all shattered :( Service: if I could give a negative star, I would. We were seated right away at the bar, but then, it had been at least 10 minutes, and no one had taken the initiative to give us a menu or offer a drink. My boyfriend ended up getting a menu himself up front. After that, still nothing. So I asked the chef at the bar (I think he's the owner), and he seemed completely uninterested in helping us. It was a busy night, but the lack of attention and care was unacceptable. The food, once we finally ordered, was mediocre at best, and not worth the long wait. I wanted to love this place, but the poor service overshadowed everything else. I won’t be returning anytime soon.

This place is a F N joke!!! I took my car to the Henderson shop to get an oil change and on my car, there is a plastic cover on the bottom that you have to take off to get to the oil filter. The lazy mechanic took it off and never put it back. And I just changed my air filter, and they tell me it needs to be replaced—WTF. They claim they put in a synthetic blend oil—Yeah, right. DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR THERE!!!! I should have known. I will never again take my car to these losers. 

Their lack of professionalism and attention to detail is appalling. A simple oil change shouldn't result in missing parts and unnecessary upsells. I regret not researching better before choosing this shop. For the sake of your vehicle and peace of mind, find a reputable place that will treat your car with care and honesty. Avoid this shop at all costs!

I ate here last week. I initially enjoyed the ambiance, the nice wait staff, and the wide selection of sushi, robata, and cocktails. However, our food and drinks were littered with inedible garnishes. One of our drinks contained inedible wood sticks and leaves, while the plate came with a side of hollowed out crustacean appendages.\n\nWhile I understand that the harvested tree parts add to the flavor of the drink, the crustacean carcases added nothing to the plate other than to disgust their customers. It was a disappointing distraction from an otherwise promising meal. The sushi was fresh and the robata skewers well-cooked, but these unnecessary embellishments took away from the dining experience. The presentation seemed overly focused on theatrics rather than enhancing the flavor or aesthetic value of the dishes. 

The wait staff was attentive and tried their best to explain the concept behind these additions, but it still felt excessive and pretentious. I appreciated their effort to elevate the dining experience, but the execution fell short of the mark. 

Despite these setbacks, the restaurant has potential. If they dial back on the unnecessary garnishes and focus more on the quality and simplicity of their dishes, it could be a fantastic dining destination. Until then, I might think twice before revisiting, unless they make these changes.

I had mentioned to my boyfriend that I needed to renew my eyeglass prescription, and he mentioned the deal America's Best had where you can get an eye exam and 2 pairs of glasses, including the lenses, for $69.99. I needed contacts as well and when I called the store, I specifically asked if there was a way to get both the eyeglass and contact lens exam for an additional cost. The woman on the phone told me for $79.99 I could have both the eyeglass exam and contact lens exam, so just $10 more. 

When I arrived at the store, the staff was friendly and prompt. The eye exams were thorough, and the optometrist took the time to explain my results, which I appreciated. Although the selection of frames was somewhat limited, I did find a pair I liked. The checkout process was smooth, and they honored the pricing discussed over the phone. Overall, I left satisfied with both the service and the value

We dined here this evening with my daughter's dance studio being located in the same plaza. We were both super excited to get a Greek place nearby and had waited anxiously since we saw the signage up prior to opening. It was pretty disappointing, I am sad to say :(

We had to wait about 5 minutes at the counter to place our order and finally, I think one of the owners, came over to assist us in our order. We waited almost 40 minutes for one gyro plate and one souvlaki plate although they did bring out soup samples, which was a nice gesture. Unfortunately, the wait wasn't really worth it. The gyro was dry, and the souvlaki lacked the robust flavors we were hoping for. The tzatziki sauce, however, was fresh and tangy, which was a redeeming point. The ambiance was warm and inviting, but the service and food quality didn’t live up to expectations. We might give it another try in the future, but for

I was in Las Vegas a couple of weeks ago for work. On Friday night we went out for a group dinner at Enoteca. I have never been to this establishment but having been to Carnevino and having a WONDERFUL dinner I had expectations.

Enoteca is a bit more casual and low key than Carne and offers pastas, pizzas and a small variety of entrees.

Our group started with a selection of cheeses, Prosciutto di Parma and fried squash blossoms. Not being a huge fan of squash, I was pleasantly surprised by the crispiness and flavor of the blossoms. The cheeses were rich and paired perfectly with the savory prosciutto. For the main course, I opted for the spaghetti alla carbonara, which was creamy and indulgent without being overly heavy. The smoked pancetta added a depth of flavor that was truly satisfying. Our server was attentive, keeping our glasses filled and ensuring our needs were met. Overall, Enoteca provided a delightful dining experience that perfectly balanced

OWNERS - STAY AWAY FROM THEM!!!!!!!!\nRead the other reviews. They are all true. This company could care less about you and your tenants. I will not even go into my long long list of problems because they have an excuse to justify everything that they do to people. Look at how much time the owner spends responding to complaints on this site. He does not know how to say \""I am sorry, I did not service your account correctly, let me fix it\"". Instead he puts 100% of his effort into laying blame at everyone else's feet and deflecting any responsibility. The communication is atrocious, with emails going unanswered for weeks and phone calls rarely returned. When they do respond, the tone is often dismissive and condescending. Their lack of professionalism is astonishing, and it's clear they prioritize their bottom line over client satisfaction. Maintenance requests are either ignored or handled poorly, leaving tenants frustrated and properties in disrepair. I've heard stories of people waiting months for simple fixes, only to be met with more excuses.

The owner’s arrogance is palpable, and it's reflected in how the business is run. They seem to thrive on conflict rather than resolution, and any attempt to address concerns is met with hostility. Do yourself a favor and find a company that values integrity and accountability. Save yourself the frustration and potential financial loss. Your sanity and your tenants will thank you.

Shocker folks, I don't normally like hot dogs. The only way you can hand me a hot dog I'll actually eat is if it's fresh off the grill. With loads of ketchup...and I DO mean loads, like buckets full! If I ever think of eating a hot dog without ketchup, the world may end. The world kinda did tonight...a little.

I ordered the New York Dog and the Sweetbread Dog, plus the duck fat fries to split with my friend. I had to order the NYC Dog because I love me some classic street food vibes, and it did not disappoint. The combination of sauerkraut and spicy mustard was a surprisingly delightful departure from my usual ketchup fixation. The Sweetbread Dog was a rich, indulgent experience, with flavors that were simultaneously savory and sweet. The duck fat fries were crispy perfection, adding an irresistible crunch to our meal. Overall, this place has changed my hot dog game. Who knew I'd find hot dog nirvana?

If I could post zero stars, that's what I would do. Let me preface this with the fact that we got here at 7pm on a Saturday...busy time for sure, but a restaurant should be able to forecast for that. After placing our orders, our waiter lets me know that I got the last order of brisket available (again, it's only 7pm on a Saturday). Next, our food comes and here's where the real fun starts. My mom's pulled pork looks chopped (as opposed to actually pulled) and it's DRY AS the Sahara Desert. She could barely swallow a bite without reaching for her drink. Meanwhile, my brisket, supposedly the last precious portion, was lukewarm and lacked any semblance of flavor. The sides were forgettable at best, and the service, though friendly, couldn't compensate for the kitchen's failings. For a place that boasts about its 'authentic BBQ', this was a colossal letdown. Never again. Save
